metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9465 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
In task_get_unused_fd_flags of binder.c, there is a possible memorycorruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation ofprivilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interactionis not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-69164715 References: Upstream kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9465` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
